releaseNotes.title: Standby, AppIntents, iOS17
releaseNotes.description:
- Minimum iOS version requirement raised to iOS 16.
- Shortcut actions converted to App Intents for enhanced interaction.
- EasyMQTT widgets now supported in iOS 17's new "standby" mode.
- Under-the-hood architecture change to improve reliability and testability, with UI/UX enhancements.

supportPages.title: Siri Shortcuts
supportPages.subtitle: Unlock Siri Shortcuts and create your own Shortcuts workflows. The app includes 3 Shortcuts to send messages and favorite messages and also receive messages from a topic.

supportPages.title: Send message shortcut
supportPages.subtitle: This shortcut allows you to send a message to a selected MQTT Broker. The message is sent as text, but can be formatted as for example JSON.

supportPages.title: Send favorite shortcut
supportPages.subtitle: This shortcut allows you to send a message from your saved favorite messages to a selected MQTT Broker. New favorite messages can be created in the app under the **Publish** tab.

supportPages.title: Fetch message shortcut
supportPages.subtitle: This shortcut subscribes to a topic and returns the first message received. There is only about a 10 second time window that the shortcut is allowed to run, so if possible use retained messages to make this more reliable.

supportPages.title: MQTT widget
supportPages.subtitle: This widget fetches and displays an MQTT message. It can either display the whole message, or just one specific value by setting the property path. JSON payloads will be highlighted.

supportPages.title: Graph widget
supportPages.subtitle: This widget displays a graph of a value from MQTT messages over time. Using the property path you can pick out a specific value from a sensor, for example the temperature or voltage.

supportPages.title: Multi-graph widget
supportPages.subtitle: Multi-graph widgets are customizable widgets that can display graphs from multiple topics. They are created and customized in the app and can then be used on the home screen. They feature live updates and customization options like graph color, update interval and more. Multi-graph widgets are part of EasyMQTT Plus.

items.title: The app wonâ€™t connect to my broker
items.text: First, try a public broker and see whether the app is able to connect to that (for example broker.emqx.io). If that connection works, check whether the connection details you entered for your own broker are correct. If everything looks good, get in touch!

items.title: Where can I find MQTT error and status messages?
items.text: If you go to the **Settings** tab, there's a section for **App logs**. This is where EasyMQTT stores things like error messages from connecting to brokers or status messages from widgets and shortcuts running in the background.

items.title: What's the Client ID used for?
items.text: The client ID is used for the broker to identify the connecting client. Most brokers only allow one client with the same ID and will disconnect any other clients with the same ID. To get around that, in the **Settings** tab there's a way to set a **Device ID** which is used to uniquely identify your device.

items.title: I have some ideas/requests for new features, where can I submit those?
items.text: Feature requests can be discussed on the [Discord server](https://discord.gg/QYwjYEKFCp) or [via email](mailto:contact@easymqtt.app). Scroll down to the Contact section ðŸ‘‡

items.title: How do I configure Shortcuts?
items.text: You can create Shortcuts either directly from the app using the **Add to Siri** button, or what I would recommend using the Shortcuts app. Press the + button and search for **EasyMQTT**.

items.title: Why can't I see any options for brokers?
items.text: To see your brokers when setting up a Shortcut you first need to create it in the app. Go either to the **Connect** tab or the **Settings** tab to create your broker, hit save and you should be good to go!

items.title: Is it possible to trigger shortcuts from received MQTT messages?
items.text: Unfortunately due to some Shortcuts and background update limitations, triggering Shortcuts is not yet possible.

items.title: Can I send JSON payloads?
items.text: Yes! Due to the way the Shortcuts app works, the payload has to be entered as text but sending a JSON payload as text should work perfectly fine. For complex payloads I'd recommend using a text editor and then copy the final text over to the shortcut.

items.title: Why does my Fetch shortcut not receive anything?
items.text: Shortcuts have a limited amount of time they're allowed to run, so the Fetch Shortcut currently listens for a new message for up to 10 seconds before completing. Due to that, I'd recommend using that Shortcut with a topic that contains a **retained** message to make things more reliable.

items.title: How do widgets work?
items.text: Widgets receive data over a configured MQTT topic and display the received messages. Graph and Multi-graph widgets let you draw a graph of values over time, for example from messages received form a sensor.

items.title: What's the difference between Graph and Multi-graph widgets?
items.text: Graph widgets are available to anyone and can be configured on the home screen. Multi-graph widgets are included with EasyMQTT Plus, they support multiple graphs, live updates and can be configured in the app. Additionally, they can also be added to the home screen.

items.title: Why is my widget not updating/receiving data?
items.text: Due to background refresh limitations, widgets only get about 10 seconds to receive new messages. It's recommended to use **retained** messages to make updating widgets more reliable. Graph and multi graph widgets need a topic that contains a number value in order to work.

items.title: What's the property path?
items.text: The property path is how you tell your widget what exact value you want to display. Setting the property path to **payload** will display the whole message, setting it to **payload.temperature** will use only the temperature property (if available). Arrays are also supported and can be used in the following way: **payload.thermostats.[0].value**

items.title: How can I enable live updates of Multi-graph widgets?
items.text: To update Multi-graph widgets live you need to be subscribed to the topics used in the widget. Once you subscribe you should see the widget update when new values come in. If that doesn't work, try disconnecting and re-connecting to the broker.
